alert.note: Alert for Franklin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 5:58PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Nash, central Wilson and south central Franklin Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 557 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bunn, or 15 miles south of Louisburg, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilson, Elm City, Bailey, Bunn, Sharpsburg, Spring Hope, Sims, Pilot, Tar River Reservoir and New Hope. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
